formattedAddress: 4 Whitehall St, New York, NY 10004, USA
adrFormatAddress: 4 Whitehall St, New York, NY 10004, USA

originalText.text:
From the Whitehall Terminal, you can utilize for free, the Staten Island Ferry which offers you an opportunity to commute to the St. George Terminal on water. This is the best option if you’re looking to see the Statue of Liberty and you’re on a time restriction. From what most say, you can spend half a day going to tour Liberty Island and Ellis Island.

This ferry will give you the chance to see the statue and enjoy a wonderful outlet center “Empire Outlets” at St. George.

text.text:

originalText.text: Hands down one of the best tourist attractions in NYC, I very much enjoyed the trip to Staten Island on the Ferry, didn’t even feel like you were on a boat, the ride was very smooth. The Ferry also comes every 30mins which is very convenient. The terminals are equipped with restrooms for your convenience. You also get a pretty decent view of Lady Liberty. Highly recommend. (Went October 28,2023)

text.text: Hands down one of the best tourist attractions in NYC, I very much enjoyed the trip to Staten Island on the Ferry, didn’t even feel like you were on a boat, the ride was very smooth. The Ferry also comes every 30mins which is very convenient. The terminals are equipped with restrooms for your convenience. You also get a pretty decent view of Lady Liberty. Highly recommend. (Went October 28,2023)

originalText.text: Free activity in New York City offering amazing views? We had to do it. Although both terminals, Whitehall in NYC and the Staten Island Terminal were crowded, all of us managed to find a place to sit/stand in this large ferry. The ride was beautiful and lasted for about 20 minutes. We were served with gorgeous views of NYC downtown, New Jersey downtown, Staten Island and of course, the Statue of Liberty. We took the ferry around sunset time so that we got the day time views as well as the night time views with lights. Staten Island Terminal has great shopping and eateries around it. We stopped over for half an hour before getting on the return ferry.

originalText.text: Great place to take newcomers to the city for a quick over and back trip. Beautiful views of the city, Lower Manhattan, Ellis Island, and the Statue of Liberty. If you don’t have time to get to the national park islands but want to see them up closer - hop on this free ferry ride.

text.text: Great place to take newcomers to the city for a quick over and back trip. Beautiful views of the city, Lower Manhattan, Ellis Island, and the Statue of Liberty. If you don’t have time to get to the national park islands but want to see them up closer - hop on this free ferry ride.

originalText.text:
The ferry is completely free, runs regularly and is easy to pick up. Some say you get better views of the Statue of Liberty using the Staten Island Ferry than some of the Ellis Island cruises. I haven't done both but I actually can't quite imagine this to be true... As the Ellis Island boats do go directly to the island so will get you much closer views. If you're not fussed about going to the island and want to see Lady Liberty on the water, this is a lovely way to do it while saving some much-needed dollar...
Once boarding at the battery, keep on the lower deck and head immediately for the back side of the boat, and position yourself on the right hand side of the outer deck for the best views. We didn't know this so barely glimpsed her on the way out.
However, if it's crowded or you miss her, disembark on Staten Island (which you have to anyway) and board again on the next one back to Manhattan. This time, follow the same guidance but keep to the left.
